bmps.name: economically depressed. The estimated 2008 median household income for Coahoma County ($28,320) was below the state median household income ($37,818), and were in the lowest 11% of the state.2

bmps.name: (1995) estimated that each ton of soil lost to erosion was worth about
bmps.source: (1995) estimated that each ton of soil lost to erosion was worth about $6.75 per year to the farmer ($5.00 per ton for lost nutrients, and $1.75 per ton for lost soil and water capacity). The estimate of dollars lost from the watershed is about $297,000 per year (44,000 x $6.75).|name_cost_tail_trim
